news.title: Trump meme coin dinner likely to include mostly non-Americans based on top $TRUMP holders
news.summary: The top 220 $TRUMP holders are supposedly being invited to a private dinner with President Donald Trump at his golf club outside of Washington, D.C.

news.title: Trump tells Walmart to 'eat the tariffs' after retailer warned it will raise prices
news.summary: Trump blasted Walmart after the retailer warned it would raise prices due to tariffs. Trump blasted Walmart over the retailer's decision to raise prices. Walmart said it was raising prices because of tariffs.

news.title: Wealthy shoppers are splashing the cash on jewelry — so long as it's the right brand
news.summary: The world's wealthiest are continuing to adorn themselves with the finest jewelry. Even as broader luxury shoppers pull back, jewelry sales continue to rise.

news.title: Trump says he will call Putin, Zelenskyy, and NATO members on Monday to talk ceasefire, trade
news.summary: Trump said he would speak with Putin after the Russian president skipped peace talks between Russia and Ukraine in Turkey. Trump told reporters on Friday that he would talk with Putin.

news.title: 'Money is tight when you're a teacher': Student loan borrowers brace for wage garnishment
news.summary: CNBC spoke with some of the student loan borrowers in default who are bracing for the consequences of wage garnishments and Social Security offsets.

news.title: I have $50,000 in credit-card debt after my divorce, but received $30,000 after a car wreck. Do I buy a used Lexus?
news.summary: “I previously drove a fully loaded BMW X7, and driving a used Lexus feels like a big drop,” he says.

news.title: I’m 57 and ready to retire next year on $7,500 a month, but my wife says no. Who’s right?
news.summary: “I also have $300,000 in a 401(k),” he says. “My wife has a 403(b) that currently sits at $650,000.”

news.title: ‘We’re not wealthy’: My niece is marrying out of state and she has a honeymoon fund. Is that cheeky?
news.summary: “We are making plans to attend just to show support. The invitation states that our presence is a gift in itself,” he said.

news.title: ‘They will drown you too’: My co-worker found out I inherited money — and harassed me to give him a loan
news.summary: “When I didn’t give him money, this co-worker became so enraged that he went on a whispering campaign,” she said.

news.title: My father’s widow keeps sending me $200 checks in the mail. Why would she do this?
news.summary: “I sent a ‘thank you’ card and asked what it was for, but I got no answer,” she said.
